partintro.para: Anyframe's generic service has been developed based on the Generics concept supported since Java5, and provides classes that implement all the basic CRUD functions such as Service interface/implementation class based on the domain class and DAO interface/implementation class(supports Hibernate/JPA, Query Service). When applications are developed, classes of Generic service can be used unchanged or inherited to develop additional functions. generic plugin is composed of sample codes to guide how to use this generic service and reference libraries.
Install generic plugin by entering the following command in the Command window.
The installation result can be checked using the installed (mvn anyframe:installed) or the jetty:run (mvn clean jetty:run) commands.

book.part:
Generic
Generic Service has been revised to fit Anyframe referring to the concept and source codes (including templates) of AppFuse Framework (http://appfuse.org/display/APF/Home). Samples codes that used classes constituting Generic Service below can be written and used directly, or the codes generated automatically through Anyframe IDE Editor's CRUD generation function can be used.
Development through Generic Service has the following properties.
Centering on domain model objects basic CRUD codes can be easily created.
Developers can implement basic CRUD functions reusing Service classes and DAo classes provided by Generic Service, not creating Business Layer and Data Access Layer codes.
When additional functions are needed other than basic CRUD, additional functions can be implemented by inheriting the classes provided by Generic Service.
It supports Hibernate/JPA and Query Service using DAO Framework.
The diagram below is relationship among Generic Service classes.
The Generic concept is one of the biggest characteristics of Java 5. It means declaring the type of objects to be included in Collection in advance.
What used to be expressed as List list = new ArrayList(); can be expressed as List<String> list = new ArrayList<String>(); by applying Generic, and when objects other than set types, compile errors occur. Thus, casting task is eliminated and readability can improve by clarifying what types to use. Also, if Generic type is used, programmers can check errors when compiling so that unintended objects cannot be saved by clarifying wanted object types.
